text.pdl__result: The fastest animal on land is actually the Cheetah. These remarkable creatures can reach speeds up to 60-70 miles per hour (96-113 kilometers per hour) over short distances, making them the world's fastest land animals. This incredible speed is a result of their specialized body structure and muscle composition for efficient hunting in the wild. For underwater speed, the Peregrine Falcon holds the record at around 240 miles per hour (386 kilometers per hour).

pdl__model_input.content: The fastest animal on land is actually the Cheetah. These remarkable creatures can reach speeds up to 60-70 miles per hour (96-113 kilometers per hour) over short distances, making them the world's fastest land animals. This incredible speed is a result of their specialized body structure and muscle composition for efficient hunting in the wild. For underwater speed, the Peregrine Falcon holds the record at around 240 miles per hour (386 kilometers per hour).

text.pdl__result:
In Europe, the fastest land animal is also the Cheetah. However, if you're referring to aquatic speed, the European Otter takes the title for the fastest land-dwelling mammal in Europe with an average swimming speed of 5.6 kilometers per hour (3.5 mph). This is quite slow compared to Cheetahs' incredible terrestrial speeds, but it's notable for its agility and hunting strategies in water.

It's worth mentioning that there are no species native to Europe with the same exceptional running speeds as the Cheetah found in Africa. European Otters, on the other hand, excel at swimming due to their streamlined bodies and webbed feet specifically adapted for life in water.
